newsitem.title: ROMANIA: RADIO ROMANIA AFTERNOON HEADLINES AT 1 PM.
newsitem.headline: RADIO ROMANIA AFTERNOON HEADLINES AT 1 PM.

text.p: * Belgian Prime Minister Jean Luc Dehaene is expected to arrive in Bucharest and meet President Emil Constantinescu, Prime Minister Victor Ciorbea and the chairmen of parliament's two chambers.
Dehaene will also meet a Romanian businessmen.
Belgium will support Romania's bid to join the European Union, he said on his way to Bucharest.
* The lower house, the Chamber of Deputies, will debate a bill on land ownership and leasing under emergency procedures.
Under the bill, a family can purchase up to 200 hectares of land. Foreign citizens cannot own land, but Romanian citizens leaving abroad will be allowed to purchase land.

* The main opposition Party of Social Democracy will file a motion in parliament to protest against a recent government decision to set up a road tax, saying it victimised motorists and impeded free circulation.
* Ciorbea will head a delegation to Luxembourg on a two-day visit starting on Friday.
